verses.verse: God’s Glory in Creation and the Law To the leader. A Psalm of David. (Gen 1.6; Isa 40.22; Rom 1.19, 20) The heavens are telling the glory of God, and the firmament (Or dome) proclaims his handiwork.
(Ps 74.16) Day to day pours forth speech, and night to night declares knowledge.
There is no speech, nor are there words; their voice is not heard;
(Rom 10.18) yet their voice (Gk Jerome Compare Syr: Heb line) goes out through all the earth and their words to the end of the world. In the heavens (Heb In them) he has set a tent for the sun,
(Eccl 1.5) which comes out like a bridegroom from his wedding canopy, and like a strong man runs its course with joy.
(Deut 30.4; Ps 113.3) Its rising is from the end of the heavens and its circuit to the end of them, and nothing is hid from its heat.
(Ps 23.3; 93.5; 111.7; 119.98-100, 142) The law of the LORD is perfect, reviving the soul; the decrees of the LORD are sure, making wise the simple;
(Ps 12.6; 119.128, 130) the precepts of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the LORD is clear, enlightening the eyes;
(Ps 119.42) the fear of the LORD is pure, enduring forever; the ordinances of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.
(Prov 8.10; 16.24) More to be desired are they than gold, even much fine gold; sweeter also than honey and drippings of the honeycomb.
(Ps 17.4; Prov 29.18) Moreover, by them is your servant warned; in keeping them there is great reward.
(Ps 51.1, 2; 90.8; 139.6) But who can detect one’s own errors? Clear me from hidden faults.
(Ps 25.11; 32.2; 119.33) Keep back your servant also from the insolent; (Or from proud thoughts) do not let them have dominion over me. Then I shall be blameless and innocent of great transgression.
(Ps 18.2; 104.34; Isa 41.14; 43.14) Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable to you, O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.
